examples: Shadberries add visual appeal and a delicate texture to dishes.
The film received lavish praise from critics for its groundbreaking visual effects, compelling storyline, and outstanding performances.
I enjoy the vibrant colors of sweet peppers in my salad, as they add a visual appeal to the dish.
When designing a website or presentation, it's important to use visuals to break up text and convey information in a more engaging way - after all, a picture is worth a thousand words.
Your presentation is along the right lines, but I think it could benefit from more visuals to help illustrate your points.
words.defineEn: involving sight or relating to seeing
words.defineVi: liên quan đến tầm nhìn hoặc liên quan đến việc nhìn thấy

examples: The severest toil was child's play compared with this.
When the company's financial problems became too severe to overcome, the CEO called in a financial consultant for advice.
The company's prowess in driving a hard bargain has placed severe pressure on suppliers.
Trauma surgeons work tirelessly to save lives, but ultimately they realize there is a remedy for everything except death and must accept that some injuries are simply too severe.
Fibroids can cause severe pain.
words.defineEn: very bad, harsh, or intense
words.defineVi: rất xấu, khắc nghiệt, hoặc dữ dội

examples: The historian provided the right historical context for the event.
The donation was made under the auspices of the local historical society.
What is stressed rather is that the same phenomenon provides the foundation for both historical tendencies.
Jake had a lifelong fascination with history, and he finally decided to scratch the itch by traveling to historical sites around the world.
Spain has a rich history and is home to many historical landmarks, such as the Roman Aqueduct of Segovia.
words.defineEn: related to the past
words.defineVi: liên quan đến quá khứ

examples: To my way of thinking, this approach is more efficient.
I don't especially like the woman but, credit where credit's due, she's very efficient.
The new software system proved to be reliable and efficient, as it remained in action without any issues during a busy week of data processing.
There was no sort of prison system to hold offenders so the most efficient way of ridding society of them was by putting them to death.
The software developer took the time to write clean and efficient code, recognizing that if a thing is worth doing, it is worth doing well and ensuring that the program was of the highest quality.
words.defineEn: describing a system, machine, etc. that is able to reach maximum productivity with minimum waste of time, money, or energy
words.defineVi: mô tả một hệ thống, máy móc, v.v. có khả năng đạt năng suất tối đa với mức lãng phí thời gian, tiền bạc hoặc năng lượng tối thiểu

examples: The local factory produces electronic components.
The flight attendant scanned my electronic ticket before I boarded the plane.
It will take an electronics expert to dismantle it.
The tech company's latest product was the frontrunner in the race to develop the next big thing in consumer electronics, with innovative features and a sleek design.
Its entire government is electronic.
words.defineEn: (of a device) having very small parts such as chips and obtaining power from electricity
words.defineVi: (của một thiết bị) có các bộ phận rất nhỏ như chip và lấy năng lượng từ điện

examples: They are on their uppers but manage to hide the fact from their friends.
During the negotiations, the union was able to gain the upper hand when they drew first blood by presenting a compelling argument for their demands.
When upper management does the same the law slaps them on the wrist.

The stiff upper lip that had gotten the British thorough the London Blitz during World War II just wasn't the right attitude for a population that was now much more willing to show their emotions publicly.
Despite all of the hardships he faced, John always kept a stiff upper lip and didn't let anything bother him.
words.defineEn: situated above something similar
words.defineVi: nằm trên một cái gì đó tương tự

examples: When Sarah's friends teased her about her unusual tastes in music and art, she reminded them that every Jack has his Jill, and she would eventually find someone who appreciated her interests.
This illustrated family record is unusual.
The person may have unusual mannerisms.
Lamborghini situation is not unusual.
Kathy's situation is not unusual.
words.defineEn: not commonly happening or done
words.defineVi: không thường xảy ra hoặc thực hiện

examples: Southern hornbill is the name of the species.
And southern latitudes will have more daylight than nighttime.
To this point, every commander of the Union army had underestimated southern determination.
I like your Southern accent.
On Friday, a Republican Senate group will visit the Southern border.
words.defineEn: directed toward or situated in the south
words.defineVi: hướng về phía hoặc nằm ở phía nam

examples: The appointment of a woman was one in the eye for male domination.
Don't introduce a new male when the hens are sitting.

He always warned his friends to be cautious of women, saying that the female of the species is more deadly than the male and that they should never underestimate a woman's ability to manipulate and deceive.
Many people assume that men are naturally better at sports, but time and time again, female athletes have proven that the gray mare is the better horse, often outperforming their male counterparts.
Do males have pouches?
words.defineEn: relating to men or the male gender
words.defineVi: liên quan đến nam giới hoặc giới tính nam

examples: After his breakup, Nicholas experienced a dry spell and went without any sexual encounters for several months.
However, they quickly realized that their love and support for her shouldn't be affected by her sexual orientation.
A guilty verdict against Cosby would go a long way toward opening the floodgates for women to report sexual assault instead of repressing it.
Sexual violence was a common fixture as well.
Sometimes people become hyper sexual.
words.defineEn: involving or related to the physical activity of sex
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc liên quan đến hoạt động thể chất của tình dục

examples: Raw milk is commonly used in certain traditional desserts, like rice pudding and flan.
The farmers' market sells raw milk, which some people enjoy for its natural goodness.
The singer's acoustic performance showcased her raw talent, captivating the audience with the purity and emotion of her voice in its most authentic form.
You struck a raw nerve when you mentioned divorce.
After a long day at the beach, Emily and her friends enjoyed a refreshing swim in the ocean, feeling the freedom of being in the raw.
words.defineEn: describing food that is not cooked
words.defineVi: mô tả thức ăn không được nấu chín

examples: Our media houses consider themselves to be holier than the Pope himself.
This is why followers are often holier than the pope and more extreme in their viewpoints than the master.
Holy schnikes, dude.
Holy cow, look at this.
Holy cow, that's intimidating.
words.defineEn: related to a religion or to God
words.defineVi: liên quan đến một tôn giáo hoặc với Thiên Chúa

examples: Even if one is confident in his innocence, it is not appropriate to be a judge in his own cause, as it undermines the credibility of the decision-making process.
We advise a food sensitivity test to better identify true food intolerances and appropriate amount of time to keep out of your system for optimal health and healing.
You'll have to wait until you've been contacted by the appropriate member of the administration
If you're planning a hike in the mountains, be sure to check the weather forecast and bring appropriate gear.
The regulations are scheduled to go into effect next winter, and in the interim, we'll be working hard to make all of the appropriate changes.
words.defineEn: suitable, fitting, or acceptable for a given situation
words.defineVi: phù hợp, phù hợp, hoặc chấp nhận được cho một tình huống nhất định

examples: He planted a gentle kiss on her cheek.
The hiker enjoyed the scenic beauty of the river's gentle bends.
With a gentle push, the window closed tightly, sealing out the draft.
Brian was as gentle as a lamb and wouldn't hurt anyone.
I need to find a gentle soap for sensitive skin.
words.defineEn: showing kindness
words.defineVi: thể hiện lòng tốt

examples: I was feeling guilty.
Judging by the evidence presented in court, the defendant is clearly guilty.
He looks guilty as sin, yes, but he insists he's innocent.
I hope this guilty verdict puts that rat of a CEO in his place.
Many judges admitted that the Dodge was their guilty pleasure out of our field.
words.defineEn: at fault for an illegal act or something bad that has happened
words.defineVi: có lỗi vì một hành động bất hợp pháp hoặc điều gì đó tồi tệ đã xảy ra

examples: European architecture is known for its stunning cathedrals and castles.
Foreign car manufacturers have made inroads into the European market.
With the signing of the treaty, a powerful new European alliance first saw the light of day.
The course gives you a bird's eye view of European art history.
The Japanese company is light years ahead of its European competitors.
words.defineEn: related to Europe or its people
words.defineVi: liên quan đến châu Âu hoặc người dân của nó

examples: She found a dirty stain on her favorite shirt.
She had to clean her dirty car after a long road trip.
He wore dirty shoes that left muddy footprints on the floor.
The dirty dishes in the restaurant's kitchen needed to be washed.
He had a dirty face after playing in the mud.
words.defineEn: having stains, bacteria, marks, or dirt
words.defineVi: có vết bẩn, vi khuẩn, vết hoặc bụi bẩn

examples: Is he upset?
My baby gets upset when I leave the room.
At first, I was upset when my ex cheated on me.
I'm not upset that vacation time might be reduced because I have no horse in this race.
He brewed a cup of ginger tea to soothe his upset stomach.
words.defineEn: unhappy, worried, or disappointed, often because something unpleasant happened
words.defineVi: không vui, lo lắng hoặc thất vọng, thường là vì điều gì đó khó chịu đã xảy ra

examples: The inner box holds the cheese and has holes in it.
The inner box holds the cheese and has holes in it.
My father had a living in an inner suburb of Leeds which had been going down in the world for decades.
The film incorporated abstract imagery and surreal elements to convey the protagonist's inner emotional journey.
The talented artist painted a beautiful portrait of a woman, capturing her strength and inner beauty on the canvas.
words.defineEn: located inside; near the center
words.defineVi: nằm bên trong; gần trung tâm

examples: He's just brilliant.
Three cheers for Sarah, whose brilliant goal at the last minute won us the game!
That was a brilliant pass by Holden.
It's a brilliant place for hearing about jobs through the grapevine.
He had a nose for trouble and a brilliant tactical mind.
words.defineEn: extremely clever, talented, or impressive
words.defineVi: cực kỳ thông minh, tài năng, hoặc ấn tượng

examples: I'm finding the advanced physics a bit heavy going.
When discussing the limitations of artificial intelligence, I point out that even the most advanced algorithms can make mistakes, for even Homer nods.
He had to work hard to keep up with his classmates in the advanced math course.
The company's latest smartphone model goes one better than its predecessor with a more advanced camera system.
He reminded himself that he that stays in the valley will not get over the hill, and enrolled in advanced classes.
words.defineEn: recently developed or implementing the latest ideas, methods, etc.
words.defineVi: được phát triển gần đây hoặc thực hiện các ý tưởng, phương pháp mới nhất, v.v.

examples: The only question is whether the President can use his extraordinary political skills to turn the tables on his opponents.
The network is probably extraordinary.
Synthetic polymers have extraordinary traits.
But these wild experiments also produced extraordinary misconceptions.
And extraordinary claims require extraordinary proof.
words.defineEn: very unusual, special, or surprising
words.defineVi: rất bất thường, đặc biệt, hoặc đáng ngạc nhiên

examples: Brown algae have complex life cycles with genetic diversity.
Genetic conditions like diabetes and high blood pressure often run in families, and it's important to be aware of your family history for early detection and prevention.
Alex's genetics make him prone to premature aging, and he often looks like he's on the wrong side of sixty, even though he's in his fifties.
Genetics are a part of it.
The last comparison is genetics.
words.defineEn: connected to the parts of the DNA in cells, called genes
words.defineVi: kết nối với các phần của DNA trong tế bào, được gọi là gen

examples: The museum is a fascinating place to learn about history and art.
The monkey's intelligence and adaptability made it a fascinating creature to study.
I find it fascinating to learn about the wonders of the natural world through science.
This meeting was fascinating.
Today's question is fascinating.
words.defineEn: extremely interesting or captivating
words.defineVi: cực kỳ thú vị hoặc quyến rũ

examples: I enjoyed the temporary exhibition at the museum, which featured contemporary art from around the world.
He was sitting as a temporary judge.
He traced patterns in the sand with his foot, leaving temporary imprints.
He felt a sense of relief when the doctor assured him that his stomach issue was temporary.

The family who lost their home in a natural disaster had to live in a temporary shelter for several months, but they endured the difficult circumstances with patience and resilience, knowing that what cannot be cured must be endured.
words.defineEn: existing for a limited time
words.defineVi: tồn tại trong một thời gian giới hạn
